answers.answer: Ive exclusivly breasyfed all 3 of mine.  I loved it!

My son had latching problems and didn't latch until 3 months after his birth. He was a Preemie and we finally got help from a lactation consultant. We made preeclampsia to 20 months old he weaned due to the pregnancy. I will breast feed again. It was super tough in the beginning but so worth it in the end.

My 1st I didn't but my.2nd I did and I'm planning to with this one. My daughter was only 34-35 weeks when born and had issues latching on so I started out pumping and bottle feeding her the milk but after close to a week she latched on. The nurses told me some kids can't latch right away and thats how they told me to.do it and I.never had issues after that. And I would rather pump then do formal again lol
Sorry auto correct it should say it* not preeclampsia.

I have three children and I've breastfed all of them. My first I breastfed for 6 months but quit because with work and pumping I dried up. With my second I breastfed for 18 months and I am currently breastfeeding my third who is 10 weeks old.
Breastfed all 4 and will this one too. Totally freaked me out with baby #1because I didnt expect to really enjoy it and the convenience.
I exclusively breastfed my first for 13 months. I will breastfed this one as long as I can, but I will have to go back to work and we don't have a good pump. We will see.

question: I'm thinking about breastfeeding my baby as my other to kids wcouldn't latch on . How many people breastfeed there babys
title: breastfeeding
